title: Context Changes Meaning
content: The same cue can mean different things depending on context. A high pressure reading during startup might be normal; the same reading during steady-state operation might indicate a problem. Comprehension requires interpreting cues within their contextâ€”operating phase, recent activities, environmental conditions, and system history all matter.

mcq.question: You observe a crew member running across the work area. What determines whether this is concerning?

options.A: Running is always unsafe and should be stopped
options.B: Context: emergency vs. late for break vs. responding to radio call
options.C: Their role determines whether running is appropriate
options.D: Time of day indicates whether it's normal

mcq.explanation: Running could indicate emergency response (urgent), being late (benign), or responding to a call (depends). Without context, you can't comprehend the meaning of what you perceive.

openQuestions: What contextual factors most affect how you interpret cues in your operation?
Describe a situation where context completely changed the meaning of what you observed.
